nl.inl.blacklab.index

Class DocIndexerFactoryConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.index.DocIndexerFactoryConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DocIndexerFactory

    public class DocIndexerFactoryConfig
extends Object
implements DocIndexerFactory
    A DocIndexerFactory implementation that automatically adds configurations in the formats/ dir in the jar and scans the default config directories for subdirectories called "config", then loads any configurations within those directories. Instances of this class can be used to add additional configs within customized directories.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • finder

        protected Function<String,Optional<ConfigInputFormat>> finder
        Return a config from the supported list, or load it if it's in the unloaded list.

        Why this function? Formats can depend on each other, and this is a mechanism to allow formats to get/lazy-load other formats registered with this factory. Why lazy-loading? Formats only refer to other formats by their name, not their file location, so we need to find them all before we actually load them. Those found config files are kept in the unloaded map until they are loaded

      • addFormatsInDirectories

        public void addFormatsInDirectories(List<File> dirs)
                             throws InvalidInputFormatConfig
        Locate all config files (files ending with .blf.yaml, .blf.yml, .blf.json) within the list of directories and load them. Formats will use their filename (excluding the .blf.* extension) as a unique identifier. Duplicate formats are ignored. Note that the actual loading of the configs is deferred until this factory is initialized by registering it with DocumentFormats, if not already done. This is a one-time scan, so configs placed in these directories after this scan will not be picked up.

        If any of the config files depend on other config files, the locations of those dependencies must also be provided in this list of directories. If config A refers to config B, then the directory where config B is located must also be present in the dirs list.
        Parameters:
        dirs -
        Throws:
        InvalidInputFormatConfig - when one of the formats could not be loaded
